content.description: Start at the base of a large,left facing corner between Hallowen III and Bondi Beach.The route in 1973  was  graded 5.7+ modern ways now consider it a tricky and serious route of 5.9 .   P1). Climb the corner and continue to Dedication Ledge. Belay below the right end of a small overhang about 20'up.5.4 60'   P2). Climb up and right for 30' to a knife blade. Step right into a shallow corner and follow it up and left to a belay below the obvious yellow,right leaning corner below a steep bulge. 90' 5.9   P3). Go up a short crack,over a buldge and into a shallow groove. Follow the groove to the break below the final bulge.Traverse the break up and left to a tree. 60' 5.7....Descend from here two raps with two ropes.
content.location: Humphreys Ledge.Guide Book :- North Conway Rock Climbs by Jerry Handren

content.description: One of the newer routes on the cliff. While the climb is a little bit short, it offers some fun, well protected moves. Climb the blocky start to Soul Survivor, but rather than climb into the deep offwidth, step right and make a trick move onto the arete at an obvious thin flake. Fiddle in some small pro, then follow the flake right to the first bolt. A few more face moves gain a second bolt. Follow lower angled rock past some bushes to 2 bolt anchor. Pass the rings and lower.
content.protection: Single rack with some small cams, 2 bolts.
content.location: The arete with 2 bolts to the right of the Soul Survivor offwidth.

climbs.name: Soul Survivor
climbs.fa: Paul Ross Joe Cote (alt leads) 1972 .FFA. Mark Hudon Mike Hartrich 1974

content.description: The route climbs the long left leaning dike in the center of the cliff. The bottom of the dike is just to the right of an angular buttress with a couple of sharp aretes. Soul Survivor starts to the right of this buttress up the big ,right facing with converging walls . Between climbs Right Arete and Under Toe. Ross followed the crux second pitch free.   P1). Climb the corner then exit left to a tree ledge.70' 5.7   P2). Follow the dike to the big overhang. Old bolts protect hard moves over the overhang,then follow the easier dike to the bolt anchors of Robinson Crusoe ,beside the white birch tree.100' 5.11a.   P3).Above the anchor the dike deepens into a chimney. Stem up the chimney and follow the continuation dike to the trees.100'5.8
content.location: Humphreys Ledge.Dedication area.. Guide book North Conway Rock Climbs by Jerry Handren

climbs.name: Six Bolts and a Plug
climbs.fa: May 2008, George Hurley and Joe Perez

content.description: A nice face climb that requires a good variety of moves. Follow the line of six bolts that angles slightly left. The left side of the overlap at the top of the climb is expanding so use care. Also be extremely careful not to knock any loose rock (there is lots!) off the tree ledge at the top of the climb.
content.protection: Bring six draws and a #2 camalot for the overlap at the top. Belay from a tree with slings and rap rings on a nice ledge tree ledge.
content.location: SBAAP starts 25' to the left of the route Dedication. (Check the Webster guidebook for details on finding Dedication, and then move left.) Rappel off of this one or climb an upper wall route such as: Dr. Leakey I Presume ( 5.9+R)

climbs.name: Shifty Eyes
climbs.fa: Peter Lewis, Brian Johnston, Dave Kelly, Summer 2001

content.description: A well bolted, low angle face climb on clean rock. Surprised no one added this one already. This is one of the cleaner and more straightforward routes on an otherwise under-explored section of the cliff. Climb straight up on thin, sometimes awkward moves, past 5 nicely spaced bolts until you can pull onto the ledge above and lower off.
content.location: Look for the deep corner with an offwidth in the back, this is Soul Survivor. Shifty Eyes is the obvious sport route to the right.

climbs.name: Robinson Crusoe
climbs.fa: Michael Hartrich, Albert Dow, and Ed Webster: 9/12 & 9/13, 1981

content.description:
1 - Up blocky terrain to open corner to tree ledge (loose gravel and rock) - 5.9+ 

  2- Easier climbing leads to overlap/roof, pull over on left (bolt), up open groove (crux, bolts & small cams), bolt belay near dying tree - 5.10b  

  3 - Up and right over Soul Survivor dike, up headwall (lighter rock), right facing corner, to another corner on left, top slab to bolt belay - 5.9 

  Alternative to pitch 3 would be Diss-N-Dazz (5.10c).
content.protection: Some pins and bolts plus standard rack for this area, possibly some extra small cams and a large cam (to help protect roof/overlap on pitch 2). Belays are tree (1) and bolts (2 & 3).
content.location:
See Ed Webster guide (Rock Climbs in the White Mtns of NH) for full cliff description. Up trail past boulders near road, up to cliff, head left, starts in broken terrain under Castaways. 

  Can do 3 raps with one 60m, but the first rappel is close!  Solidly knot the ends on the first rap, might need to scramble or pull over to bolt belay. Using two ropes is a safer option.

content.description: Start as for Halloween II, then break out on the left face of the corner. Climb past 4 bolts onto the ledge above. Take care not to knock down kitty litter on the ledge. Finish at a tree with some tat near a few stacked blocks.
content.protection: 4 bolts and few small cams to supplement.
content.location: Same start as Halloween II, break out of the corner a few feet up.

content.description:
Description: Difficult steep face climbing. 5 bolts and some gear at mid-height. 

        Pitch 1: Climb the face past three bolts, make a dynamic move to a horizontal hold (possible .5), move feet up and shoot for the top of the block (.5-.75 behind the block). Make a delicate and difficult mantle move up to a rest and 4th bolt. move slightly left to an obvious flake and undercling and make thin moves up and left of next bolt. A balancy exit move will hold your attention until you are clear of the slab.
content.protection:
draws and cams from 0.5-.075 

  5 bolts 

  Tree anchor with stainless rap rings
content.location:
Directions:   Located on a face 20' right of the Dedication Corner (12' right of Bondi Beach). Good spacious, and flat stance for the belay. 

  Descent: Rappel from the trees

content.description: This is a fun, mostly bolted (6) single-pitch face climb near the dedication corner.  Interesting crimp and side-pull moves with several rests.  A 1"-ish cam can help protect the pullover at the top of the climb.  Bolted rap-ring anchor at the top.
content.location: Ten feet left of the Dedication Corner.

content.description: This route starts at the beginning of the Dedication Ledge at a small flake. Climb up a right facing corner up towards the overlap above. When you reach the overlap, step right to pass over it, then climb up a few more moves until you can reach the tree anchor on the ledge. As with all the routes on this wall, be careful not to knock down kitty litter or rocks from the ledge.
content.location: Look for a corner capped by an overlap, with a bolted route that breaks left from it (Over Arch) and another bolted route 10 feet to the right (Six Bolts And A Plug).

content.description:
From the two-bolt belay atop the second pitch of Robinson Crusoe, follow the Soul Survivor dike up into the corner with the nice handcrack on the right. Stem up and into the crack, then traverse up and right to the first bolt. Follow the arete to the next bolt (exciting!), then climb up the corner and exit left at the top, passing two more bolts on the way. Easy slab with cracks for gear leads up and right to the rappel anchor of Robinson Crusoe. 

  A much harder, but better protected and more fun finish to Robinson Crusoe.
content.protection: Single rack, 4 bolts to 2 bolt rappel anchor.
content.location: This is a 3rd pitch route that ends atop the cliff. Start in the Soul Survivor dike, break right across the bolted arete then corner, and finish up and right on slabs to the anchor.

content.description: A stiff little number. Ever thinning crack line that ends just in time. Was very hard with fixed knifeblades and rated 5.10 now has bolts.
content.protection: thin gear and bolts- tree anchor
content.location: In the middle of the cliff on a small buttress. The groove line above is Robinson Crusoe.

content.description: This is the area that has Robinson Crusoe and Castaways on it. And it has some of the longer pitches on it.
